review: Very impressed so far with this device. I realize it's not the same as a Chromecast but it's hands down a much more reliable and consistent tv experience.I also appreciate the kid-related offerings on it, specifically Prime tv shows and movies. Backyardigans and Thomas are two shows we watch on occasion and both stream very well so far.
author: Bart

review: While I have nothing to compare it to, I am very satisfied with it. It is small and unobtrusive. The remote , while small and very simple works like a charm except when rewinding or  fast forwarding during movies. The voice function search feature is terrific.I also own a Kindle Fire HDX of which I love and works nicely with the Fire TV.  I'm currently enjoying prime for free but will purchase the full subscription when able to renew.  If you love movies and music Amazon Prime is a must and worth every penny.
author: mark francis

review: Works just like the full sized Fire TV box, except WiFi only (no Ethernet jack), no RCA and fiber audio output (HDMI only), and no voice search on the remote (but I think you can buy a remote with voice search).  I gave it five stars because it works great considering the price.  However, I sometimes have to reconnect to the network when I first start using it if it's been sitting awhile, even though Wifi signal is strong and no issues with other devices.  My full sized Fire TV box that I've had for a year is connected via Ethernet cable, and has no issues.  Hopefully this slight quirk can be corrected in firmware soon.  All things considered (including price), I'm quite happy with it.
